required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Double-blind Randomized Placebo-controlled Study Study of the Safety, Reactogenicity and Immunogenicity of the GamFluVac
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind Randomized Placebo-controlled Study of Safety and Immunogenicity of Medicinal Product With a Period of Open Safety Assessment in Two Modes of Administration, in Healthy Volunteers

lead_sponsor.agency: Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology, Health Ministry of the Russian Federation

collaborator.agency: Main military clinical hospital named after academician N. N. Burdenko

clinical_study.source: Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology, Health Ministry of the Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study is at the first stage: a comparative assessment of the safety of the two methods of vaccine administration, at the second - an assessment of the safety and state of post-vaccination immunity at different times after vaccination

detailed_description.textblock:
In the first stage estimate of safety of vaccine after its single administration to the nasal cavity by the drip method or by spray - dispenser during the period of observation in 30 days with the participation of 24 volunteers, divided into 2 groups of 12 people for each method of administration
After interim analysis of safety data is subject to the consent of the local ethics Committee of the Research Centre about the possibility of further studies of the drug - will be started the second phase of the study, which, along with continued security research, provides the definition of the parameters of immunogenicity of the study drug. The second phase of the study will included 200 participants, including 100 people will receive the study drug and 100 will be a control group of observation - that is, will get a placebo.

study_design_info.masking_description: This clinical trial on the second stage is designed as a double blind randomized placebo-controlled study

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: through the whole study, an average of 180 days
primary_outcome.description: Determination of Number of Participants With Adverse Events

primary_outcome.measure: Antibody levels a measured by an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through the whole study, an average of 90 days
primary_outcome.description: Determination of antibody levels measured by an ELISA vs. baseline values and vs placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of antigen-specific cell-mediated immune response
secondary_outcome.description: determination of specific T-cell- mediated response vs. baseline values ans vs placebo

arm_group.description: The total number of recombinant pseudo-adenoviral particles (2.5 ± 1.25) × 1011 VP/dose administrated by intranasal drip

arm_group.arm_group_label: Stage 1 (GamFluVac with the help of a spray dispenser)
arm_group.description: The total number of recombinant pseudo-adenoviral particles (2.5 ± 1.25) × 1011 VP/dose administrated intranasally with the help of a spray dispenser
The total number of recombinant pseudo-adenoviral particles (2.5 ± 1.25) × 1011 VP/dose

intervention.description: The drug is a vaccine that induces high-level immunity against influenza A viruses
intervention.arm_group_label: Stage 1 (GamFluVac with the help of a spray dispenser)

overall_official.affiliation: Federal state budgetary institution " Main military clinical hospital named after academician N. N. Burdenko " of the Ministry of Defence of the Russian Federation

facility.name: Federal state budgetary institution " Main military clinical hospital named after academician N. N. Burdenko " of the Ministry of Defence of the Russian Federation
